revised_title: Fine-Structure of Soft X-ray Absorption Edges in Metals
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using X-ray absorption spectroscopy to study the fine-structure of soft X-ray absorption edges in metals like Li, Mg, Ni, and Cu. They determined the density of unoccupied energy levels in the metals and observed the variations of the absorption coefficient for radiation between 100 and 300 A. This research provided insights into the understanding of the complex region where the first two Brillouin zones overlap.
